rules: Rule1: Provided that artwork1 requires conservation, then artwork1 is preserved.
Rule2: Whenever artwork1 requires an environmental assessment, then either artwork1 is located in a protected area or artwork1 is preserved.
Rule3: If a historical landmark is near artwork1, then either there is an archaeological site nearby artwork1 or artwork1 requires an environmental assessment.
Rule4: Either a historical landmark is near artwork1 or a nature reserve is adjacent to artwork1.
Rule5: Whenever public access is allowed to artwork1, then artwork1 is preserved.
Rule6: If research access is granted for artwork1, then artwork1 is preserved.
Rule7: Either artwork1 was damaged during transport or artwork1 requires conservation.
Rule8: Provided that export of artwork1 is restricted, then there is a long-term maintenance plan for artwork1.
Rule9: Either export of artwork1 is restricted, or public access is allowed to artwork1, or research access is granted for artwork1.
Rule10: If artwork1 is domestic only, then it is not the case that export of artwork1 is restricted.
Rule11: Under the condition that artwork1 has documented provenance, then artwork1 is preserved.
Rule12: If artwork1 is museum certified, then artwork1 has documented provenance.
Rule13: Provided that artwork1 is expert authenticated, then artwork1 has documented provenance.
Rule14: Whenever artwork1 is part of a major museum collection, then artwork1 is museum certified.
Rule15: Either artwork1 is part of a major museum collection or artwork1 is privately collection owned.
Rule16: Provided that artwork1 is privately collection owned, then artwork1 is scholarly publication referenced.
Rule17: If artwork1 is auction house verified, then artwork1 is expert authenticated.
Rule18: If artwork1 was created in the Renaissance, then artwork1 requires a special permit.
Rule19: Whenever artwork1 is digital catalog included, then if artwork1 is scholarly publication referenced, artwork1 is auction house verified.
Rule20: Either artwork1 is digital catalog included or artwork1 is physical catalog available.
Rule21: If artwork1 is physical catalog available, then provided that artwork1 is scholarly publication referenced, artwork1 is auction house verified.
Rule22: Provided that artwork1 has cultural significance, then it is not the case that artwork1 was damaged during transport.

Rule23: Either traditional materials were used in artwork1 or, if it is not the case that if artwork1 has a secular subject then artwork1 is a religious artwork, then artwork1 has a mixed interpretation.
Rule24: Either modern restoration was applied to artwork1 or it is not the case that traditional materials were used in artwork1.

Rule25: Provided that conservation ethics are followed for artwork1, then if it is not the case that if it is not the case that artwork1 is preserved then chemical treatment is safe for artwork1, then it is not the case that the structural integrity of artwork1 is compromised.

Rule26: If experimental methods are used on artwork1, then under the condition that it is not the case that if it is not the case that artwork1 is preserved then chemical treatment is safe for artwork1, it is not the case that the structural integrity of artwork1 is compromised.
Rule27: Whenever artwork1 requires a special permit, then it is not the case that artwork1 was damaged during transport.
Rule28: Either previous restoration is documented for artwork1 or, if only reversible treatments are used on artwork1, then it is not the case that irreversible changes were made to artwork1.
Rule29: Either the original condition of artwork1 is known or the condition of artwork1 is hypothesized.
Rule30: Provided that the condition of artwork1 is hypothesized, then it is not the case that previous restoration is documented for artwork1.
Rule31: Under the condition that scientific analysis is completed for artwork1, then material analysis is done for artwork1.
Rule32: If material analysis is done for artwork1, then pigment analysis is performed on artwork1.
Rule33: Whenever pigment analysis is performed on artwork1, then provided that the original condition of artwork1 is known, it is not the case that previous restoration is documented for artwork1.
Rule34: Either the conservation committee approved artwork1 or individual approval is granted for artwork1.
Rule35: Provided that individual approval is granted for artwork1, then either the museum approves conservation of artwork1 or the private collector approves artwork1.
Rule36: Under the condition that an alternative approach is proposed for artwork1, then it is not the case that the conservation plan is rejected for artwork1.

Rule37: If government funding is secured for artwork1, then whenever it is not the case that if the conservation committee approved artwork1 then a conservation plan is submitted for artwork1, an alternative approach is proposed for artwork1.
Rule38: If foundation support is obtained for artwork1, then an international grant is received for artwork1.
Rule39: Under the condition that a donor network is established for artwork1, then foundation support is obtained for artwork1.

Rule40: If copyright issues are resolved for artwork1, then provided that legal clearance is obtained for artwork1, then if artwork1 is protected by law, it is not the case that an excavation permit is needed for artwork1.

Rule41: Provided that reproduction rights are cleared for artwork1, then if legal clearance is obtained for artwork1, then under the condition that artwork1 is protected by law, it is not the case that an excavation permit is needed for artwork1.
Rule42: If digital reproduction is planned for artwork1, then either copyright issues are resolved for artwork1 or reproduction rights are cleared for artwork1.
Rule43: Either digital reproduction is planned for artwork1 or physical reproduction is allowed for artwork1.
Rule44: If the exhibition is postponed for artwork1, then it is not the case that the exhibition is cancelled for artwork1.
Rule45: Under the condition that the exhibition is relocated for artwork1, then the exhibition is postponed for artwork1.
Rule46: If the main gallery is selected for artwork1, then gallery space is available for artwork1.
Rule47: Either the main gallery is selected for artwork1 or auxiliary space is used for artwork1.

Rule48: Provided that the museum approves conservation of artwork1, then whenever it is not the case that if it is not the case that artwork1 is preserved then chemical treatment is safe for artwork1, it is not the case that the structural integrity of artwork1 is compromised.
Rule49: If auxiliary space is used for artwork1, then it is not the case that an excavation permit is needed for artwork1.

Rule50: Either climate control is adequate for artwork1 or, if a nature reserve is adjacent to artwork1, then either there is an archaeological site nearby artwork1 or artwork1 requires an environmental assessment.
Rule51: Either lighting conditions are optimal for artwork1 or it is not the case that climate control is adequate for artwork1.
Rule52: Provided that security measures are sufficient for artwork1, then it is not the case that lighting conditions are optimal for artwork1.
Rule53: Under the condition that timed entry is implemented for artwork1, then a reservation system is used for artwork1.
Rule54: Either timed entry is implemented for artwork1 or general admission is allowed for artwork1.
Rule55: Whenever general admission is allowed for artwork1, then security measures are sufficient for artwork1.
Rule56: Provided that a reservation system is used for artwork1, then visitor access is controlled for artwork1.
Rule57: If an educational program is developed for artwork1, then either there is an archaeological site nearby artwork1 or artwork1 requires an environmental assessment.

Rule58: Provided that the private collector approves artwork1, then whenever it is not the case that if it is not the case that artwork1 is preserved then chemical treatment is safe for artwork1, it is not the case that the structural integrity of artwork1 is compromised.
Rule59: If a volunteer is trained for artwork1, then staff are certified for artwork1.
Rule60: Whenever a conservation report is filed for artwork1, then either an external specialist is hired for artwork1 or it is not the case that staff are certified for artwork1.
Rule61: If a monitoring system is installed for artwork1, then environmental sensors are placed for artwork1.
Rule62: Under the condition that environmental sensors are placed for artwork1, then either artwork1 is located in a protected area or artwork1 is preserved.
Rule63: Provided that annual review is planned for artwork1, then periodic assessment is scheduled for artwork1.
Rule64: Either annual review is planned for artwork1 or a biennial checkup is scheduled for artwork1.
Rule65: Whenever project1 has funding, then either the museum approves conservation of artwork1 or the private collector approves artwork1.

Rule66: If it is not the case that if a nature reserve is adjacent to artwork1 then either there is an archaeological site nearby artwork1 or artwork1 requires an environmental assessment, then an excavation permit is needed for artwork1.
Rule67: Provided that it is not the case that if artwork1 is protected by law then it is not the case that an excavation permit is needed for artwork1, then artwork1 has national heritage status.

Rule68: Under the condition that it is not the case that if artwork1 is protected by law then it is not the case that an excavation permit is needed for artwork1, then a corporate sponsor is involved with artwork1.
Rule69: If it is not the case that if artwork1 was created in the Renaissance then artwork1 has cultural significance, then artwork1 has a secular subject.
Rule70: Provided that it is not the case that if artwork1 has a secular subject then artwork1 is a religious artwork, then it is not the case that artwork1 has a mixed interpretation.
Rule71: If it is not the case that either conservation ethics are followed for artwork1 or experimental methods are used on artwork1, then irreversible changes were made to artwork1.

Rule72: Under the condition that it is not the case that either conservation ethics are followed for artwork1 or experimental methods are used on artwork1, then only reversible treatments are used on artwork1.
Rule73: If it is not the case that if the conservation committee approved artwork1 then a conservation plan is submitted for artwork1, then the conservation plan is rejected for artwork1.
Rule74: Whenever it is not the case that if a corporate sponsor is involved with artwork1 then private sponsorship is obtained for artwork1, then a donor network is established for artwork1.

Rule75: Under the condition that it is not the case that if an exhibition is scheduled for artwork1 then if physical reproduction is allowed for artwork1 then either copyright issues are resolved for artwork1 or reproduction rights are cleared for artwork1, then the exhibition is cancelled for artwork1.

Rule76: If it is not the case that if an exhibition is scheduled for artwork1 then if physical reproduction is allowed for artwork1 then either copyright issues are resolved for artwork1 or reproduction rights are cleared for artwork1, then the exhibition is relocated for artwork1.
Rule77: Provided that it is not the case that if curator training is completed for artwork1 then an educational program is developed for artwork1, then a volunteer is trained for artwork1.

Rule78: If it is not the case that if a biennial checkup is scheduled for artwork1 then it is not the case that there is a long-term maintenance plan for artwork1, then there is an emergency response plan for artwork1.

Rule79: Under the condition that it is not the case that if a biennial checkup is scheduled for artwork1 then it is not the case that there is a long-term maintenance plan for artwork1, then it is not the case that there is an emergency response plan for artwork1.
Rule80: Provided that it is not the case that if it is not the case that artwork1 is preserved then chemical treatment is safe for artwork1, then the structural integrity of artwork1 is compromised.
Rule81: Whenever it is not the case that artwork1 is domestic only, then international loan is possible for artwork1.
